thread.title: Friday night high school football wrap-up: Scores, stories, photos from Week 9 action
thread.title_full: Friday night high school football wrap-up: Scores, stories, photos from Week 9 action

author: Jack Flagler
title: Friday night high school football wrap-up: Scores, stories, photos from Week 9 action
text: Cherryville 39, Highland Tech 7: Cherryville earns first win of season, takes down Highland Tech . PHOTO GALLERY East Lincoln 48, Newton Conover 24: Chazz Surratt accounted for 509 yards of offense and five touchdowns, and East Lincoln ran its win streak to 24 in the rout. Surratt ran for 284 yards and a pair of scores, and threw for 225 yards and three touchdowns. His younger brother, Sage, had eight catches for 135 yards and two touchdowns, and Cameron Dollar added 83 yards receiving and a TD on five receptions. Alex Johnson’s 85-yard kickoff return for a TD early in the second quarter led to back-to-back scores for the Red Devils (4-4, 1-3 Southern District 7 Athletic 2A), which cut a 14-0 Mustangs lead down to 14-12. East Lincoln (8-0, 4-0) had possession with 1:19 left in the half, and went 84 yards in seven plays, the last a 28-yard hook-up between Surratts for a 21-12 lead at the break. The Mustangs, who chose to defer to the second half, opened the third quarter with a 54-yard TD run by Chazz Surratt to extend their lead. Surratt had scoring runs of 54 and 53 yards, and Coleton Banks, who had eight carries for 81 yards, scored on a pair of 19-yard runs in the final six minutes. East Lincoln managed 623 yards of total offense — 398 on the ground — while holding the Red Devils to 198. Cameron Stanley completed 13 of his 21 passes for 126 yards, and accounted for three of his team’s four scores, one a 2-yard run and the other two scoring passes to Johnson. Johnson finished with seven catches for 80 yards. Chazz Surratt was 15 of 23 from the pocket. Pine Lake Prep 26, Bessemer City 0: Taylor Hochman led off the scoring with a 7-yard touchdown run with nine seconds left in the first quarter. Harrison Heart’s 11-yard pass to Nick Lamort in the second quarter, William Harwood’s 40-yd interception return for a touchdown and a 44-yard Heart pass to Harwood rounded out the scoring. Bessemer City was led on defense by Kadrian Pitts, who tallied 15 tackles. West Caldwell 42, West Lincoln 0: West Lincoln gained 139 yards on the ground to West Caldwell’s 134, but the Rebels were outgained through the air, 180-51, in the shutout loss. Dallas Bridges (10 rushes for 44 yards) and Zane Peterson (17 rushes for 75 yards) led West Lincoln. Mountain Island Charter 48, Hickory Grove Christian 14: Junior running back Aapri Washington rushed for 401 yards on 16 carries with four touchdowns and intercepted two passes as the Raptors rolled to victory. Mountain Island Charter (3-5), which hosts Greenville, S.C., Christian Academy next Friday, also got touchdown runs from Agape Love and Justin Pendergrass and a Pendergrass TD pass to Eric Gallman. Hickory Grove Christian fell to 4-4. Northwestern 63, Clover 0: The Blue Eagles fell to 1-7, 0-3 as they prepare to play at Gaffney next week. Lincolnton 55, Bunker Hill 0: The Wolves (6-2, 3-1) rolled to the Southern District 7 2A Conference win. The Wolves host Newton-Conover next week. Statesville 44, North Lincoln 14: The Knights fell to 2-6, 1-3 as they prepare to play at league-leading South Iredell next week.
